questions.question_text: How are policies deployed on cloud-hosted Cisco SD-WAN controllers?

choices.C: Policies are created on vManage and enforced by vSmart.
choices.A: Policies are created on vManage and enforced by vManage.
choices.D: Policies are created on vSmart and enforced by vSmart.
choices.B: Policies are created on vSmart and enforced by vManage.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

questions.question_text: Which service VPN must be reachable from all WAN Edge devices and the controllers?

discussion.content: VPN0, which is underlay/transport should be reachable to build tunnel. VPN10 is just a number for a VPN, so it may not even exist. Hence Option A, VPN0 is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
Typo in question.
VPN0 should be reachable, but it is not a service VPN

VPN 0 is transport VPN, not service VPN.
There is an error on this question. They should ask VPN instead of service VPN

so my theory is that every time they add questions, they don't take into account that cisco changes the orders of the answers on newer tests. SO this iteration of the question just has the right answer as B but that was probably VPN0 on previous iterations. only thing that makes sense to me
Is This not VP0 ?
I'm thinking of a number 1-10. Guess what number I'm thinking? Lol
does not make sense.

Selected Answer: AD
Options A & D are correct. 
The vManage lost connectivity to the Fabric, but it is still accessible to the Admin. Hence, template can be created, but it can't be pushed or propagated to the Fabric due to the connectivity loss.

Selected Answer: AD
A, D seem correct. The question state loss of connectivity to the fabric and not loss of management.

Selected Answer: BD
A. Policy changes propagation stops. is not right because you don't have vManage to modify Policy.

Selected Answer: AD
AD

 A. Policy changes propagation stops. -> true / if you change a policy you cannot push it
 B. Creation of templates is impossible. -> false, you can create on vManage only
 C. BFD peering between WAN Edge devices are established. ->false
 D. Statistics collection stops. -> true
 E. IPsec tunnels tear down for WAN Edge devices. ->false

Selected Answer: BD
It is important to understand that policies are configured on vSmart or vEdge. vManage is only a graphical user interface used to create and store policies, but once a policy is activated through the vManage GUI, it is configured with a NETCONF transaction either on vSmart or vEdge. 

https://www.networkacademy.io/ccie-enterprise/sdwan/policies

Selected Answer: BD
Propagation stop? you can't modify it if you dont have vmanage.

questions.question_text: What are the two impacts of losing vManage connectivity to fabric in the Cisco SD-WAN network? (Choose two.)

choices.E: IPsec tunnels tear down for WAN Edge devices.
choices.C: BFD peering between WAN Edge devices are established.

questions.question_text: Which type of connection is created between a host VNet and a transit VNet when configuring Cloud OnRamp for lease?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C

questions.question_text: Which vBond system configuration under VPN 0 allows for a routable public IP address even if the DNS name, hostname, or IP address of the vBond orchestrator are omitted?

discussion.content:
system configuration under VPN 0 so why is the answer 'local'?
My understanding of under vpn0:
vpn 0
 interface ge0/0
 ip address 1.1.1.1/24
 ipv6 dhcp-client
 tunnel-interface
 encapsulation ipsec
 no allow-service bgp
 allow-service dhcp
 allow-service dns
 allow-service icmp
 no allow-service sshd
 no allow-service netconf
 no allow-service ntp
 no allow-service ospf
 no allow-service stun
 allow-service https

comments.content: The vBond Address would be specified in the system section of the configuration. With the addition "local" act the vEdge as vBond and not as a vEdge Device

discussion.content:
B.
Command 'local' makes vedge device to become vbond.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/cisco-sd-wan-overlay-network-bringup.html

system
 vbond x.x.x.x local

Selected Answer: B
B local
